Sentencas: Three different test geometries were used to apply shear loading to fracture glass-to-metal joints typical of seals intended for use in planar solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs): asymmetric compression; symmetric compression; and four-point asymmetric bending.
Titulo: Measurement of Mechanical Strength of Glass-to-Metal Joints

Sentencas: The measured apparent shear strengths were found to differ by an order of magnitude depending on the test configuration employed.
Titulo: Measurement of Mechanical Strength of Glass-to-Metal Joints

Sentencas: In particular, the apparent shear strength measured in the asymmetric compression test was very low.
Titulo: Measurement of Mechanical Strength of Glass-to-Metal Joints

Sentencas: Conversely, the highest apparent shear strengths were measured using the symmetric compression test and the four-point asymmetric bend test gave an intermediate result.
Titulo: Measurement of Mechanical Strength of Glass-to-Metal Joints

Sentencas: It is shown, by finite element modelling, that these differences are caused by differences in the normal stresses transverse to the joint.
Titulo: Measurement of Mechanical Strength of Glass-to-Metal Joints

Sentencas: The locus of failure was always along the glass/metal interface in all test geometries.
Titulo: Measurement of Mechanical Strength of Glass-to-Metal Joints

Sentencas: It is concluded that mechanical test procedures used to characterize glass-ceramic seals in SOFC stacks need to be selected and interpreted with great care.
Titulo: Measurement of Mechanical Strength of Glass-to-Metal Joints
